properties.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 3 at 11:37PM EST until January 4 at 3:30AM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg SC
properties.description:
The National Weather Service in Greenville-Spartanburg has issued a

* Flood Advisory for...
North central Anderson County in Upstate South Carolina...
South central Pickens County in Upstate South Carolina...

* Until 330 AM EST.

* At 1129 PM EST, the stream gauge along Eighteen Mile Creek near
Pendleton reported a water level of 11.6 feet and cresting or
slowly falling. At levels above 11.5 feet, flooding likely
continues along Central Road at the Eighteen Mile Creek crossing.
The water also remains very close to overtopping Pendleton Road
(Highway 28) north of Pendleton. Minor fluctuations in the water
level could permit some of the water to spill onto the roadway
there through the early morning hours.

* Other locations that could experience flooding include low-lying
and poor drainage areas around Pendleton, Central,  and Clemson.
properties.instruction:
Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the
dangers of flooding. Do not attempt to travel across flooded roads.
Turn around, don't drown.

A Flood Advisory means river or stream flows are elevated, or ponding
of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent.
